title: Infinite group sum on topological groups

blocks.name: ctsu
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include infinite group sums in a topological group.
blocks.origin: const class ctsu { tsums }

blocks.name: diff.ctsu.s
diff.ctsu.c
diff.ctsu.w
df-tsms
blocks.content: Define the set of limit points of an infinite group sum for the topological group ` G ` . If ` G ` is Hausdorff, then there will be at most one element in this set and ` U. ( W tsums F ) ` selects this unique element if it exists. ` ( W tsums F ) ~~ 1o ` is a way to say that the sum exists and is unique. Note that unlike ` sum_ ` ( ~ df-sum ) and ` gsum ` ( ~ df-gsum ), this does not return the sum itself, but rather the set of all such sums, which is usually either empty or a singleton. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-tsms(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(ctsu, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, csb(s2, cin(cpw(cdm(cv(s1))), cfn), cfv(co(cfv(ctopn, cv(s0)), cflf, co(cv(s2), cfg, crn(cmpt(s3, cv(s2), crab(s4, cv(s2), wss(cv(s3), cv(s4))))))), cmpt(s4, cv(s2), co(cv(s0), cgsu, cres(cv(s1), cv(s4))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: tsmsfbas
blocks.content: The collection of all sets of the form ` F ( z ) = { y e. S | z C_ y } ` , which can be read as the set of all finite subsets of ` A ` which contain ` z ` as a subset, for each finite subset ` z ` of ` A ` , form a filter base. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: tsmslem1
blocks.content: The finite partial sums of a function ` F ` are defined in a commutative monoid. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm tsmslem1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(co(c2, cgsu, cres(c3, c0)), c4))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c2))
  -| wceq(c1, cin(cpw(c5), cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, ccmn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c3, c5, c4))
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(co(c2, cgsu, cres(c3, c0)), c4)), wi(w0, wcel(c5, c6)))
  gsumcl(c2, cres(c3, c0), c4, cfv(c0g, c2), c0, c1, wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c2))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, ccmn))
  fdmfifsupp(cres(c3, c0), cfv(c0g, c2), c0, c4, universe, wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)))
  fssresd(c3, c0, c4, c5, wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wf(c3, c5, c4))
  syl(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wss(c0, c5), wcel(c0, cin(cpw(c5), cfn)))
  simplbi(wcel(c0, cin(cpw(c5), cfn)), wss(c0, c5), wcel(c0, cfn))
  elfpw(c0, c5)
  elin2d(c0, cfn, cpw(c5), wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)))
  syl6eleq(c0, cin(cpw(c5), cfn), c1, wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)))
  simpr(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
  fvexd(c0g, c2, wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)))
}

blocks.name: tsmsval
blocks.content: Definition of the topological group sum(s) of a collection ` F ( x ) ` of values in the group with index set ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm tsmsval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, ctsu, c1), cfv(co(c2, cflf, co(c3, cfg, c4)), cmpt(s0, c3, co(c0, cgsu, cres(c1, cv(s0)))))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ctopn, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cin(cpw(c6), cfn))
  -| wceq(c4, crn(cmpt(s1, c3, crab(s0, c3, wss(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c8))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c6, c5))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  tsmsval2(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, universe, w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wcel(c1, universe), wf(c1, c6, c5), wcel(c6, c8), wcel(c5, universe))
  a1i(w0, wcel(c5, universe))
  fvexi(c5, cbs, c0)
  fex2(c1, c6, c5, c8, universe)
  fdmd(c1, c6, c5, w0)
}

blocks.name: tsmspropd
blocks.content: The group sum depends only on the base set, additive operation, and topology components. Note that for entirely unrestricted functions, there can be dependency on out-of-domain values of the operation, so this is somewhat weaker than ~ mndpropd etc. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, ctsu, c1), co(c2, ctsu, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cbs, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(cplusg, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(ctopn, c0), cfv(ctopn, c2)))
} = {

thm tsmspropd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  âŠ¢ (w0 â†’(c0[tsums]c1)=(c2[tsums]c1))

} = {
  3eqtr4d((c0[tsums]c1), (c2[tsums]c1), (((TopOpen ` c0)[fLimf]((P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)[filGen]ran((hs1 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦ { hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)| hs1 âŠ† hs0 }))))`(hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦(c0[gsum](c1 |` hs0)))), (((TopOpen ` c2)[fLimf]((P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)[filGen]ran((hs1 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦ { hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)| hs1 âŠ† hs0 }))))`(hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦(c2[gsum](c1 |` hs0)))), w0)
  fveq12d(((TopOpen ` c0)[fLimf]((P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)[filGen]ran((hs1 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦ { hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)| hs1 âŠ† hs0 })))), (hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦(c0[gsum](c1 |` hs0))), ((TopOpen ` c2)[fLimf]((P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)[filGen]ran((hs1 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦ { hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)| hs1 âŠ† hs0 })))), (hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦(c2[gsum](c1 |` hs0))), w0)
  oveq1d((TopOpen ` c0), cflf, ((P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)[filGen]ran((hs1 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦ { hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)| hs1 âŠ† hs0 }))), (TopOpen ` c2), w0)
  mpteq2dv(hs0, (P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin), (c0[gsum](c1 |` hs0)), (c2[gsum](c1 |` hs0)), w0)
  gsumpropd(c0, (c1 |` hs0), c2, universe, c4, c5, w0)
  syl(w0, (c1 |` hs0)âˆˆ ğ•Œ, c1 âˆˆ c3)
  resexg(c1, c3, hs0)
  tsmsval2(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, (TopOpen ` c0), (P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin), ran((hs1 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦ { hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)| hs1 âŠ† hs0 })), (Base ` c0), dom(c1), c4, c3, w0)
  eqid((Base ` c0))

  eqid((Base ` c2))

  eqid((P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin))
  eqid(ran((hs1 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)â†¦ { hs0 âˆˆ(P(dom(c1))â‹‚ Fin)| hs1 âŠ† hs0 })))

blocks.content: The property of being a sum of the sequence ` F ` in the topological commutative monoid ` G ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.)

thm tsmsi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), c3)))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c1))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ctopn, c1))
  -| wceq(c0, cin(cpw(c6), cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, ccmn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, ctps))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c6, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, co(c1, ctsu, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, c3))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpd(w0, wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), c3)))), wcel(c8, c3))
  rspcdva(hs0, c3, c5, w0, wi(wcel(c8, c3), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), c3))))), wi(wcel(c8, cv(hs0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0)))))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(c8, cv(hs0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0))))), wcel(c8, c3), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), c3)))))
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c3, c8)
  rexralbidv(s0, s1, c0, c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c3), wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0))), wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), c3)))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), c3), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), c3))
  eleq2(cv(hs0), c3, co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))))
  simprd(w0, wral(hs0, c5, wi(wcel(c8, cv(hs0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0))))))), wcel(c8, c4))
  mpbid(w0, wa(wcel(c8, c4), wral(hs0, c5, wi(wcel(c8, cv(hs0)), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), cv(hs0)))))))), wcel(c8, co(c1, ctsu, c2)))
  eltsms(hs0, s0, s1, c8, c1, c2, c4, c5, c0, c6, c7, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wcel(c8, c3), wrex(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wi(wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(co(c1, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(s1))), c3))))))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c3)

blocks.name: tsmsgsum
blocks.content: The convergent points of a finite topological group sum are the closure of the finite group sum operation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Sep-2015.) (Revised by AV, 24-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: tsmsid
blocks.content: If a sum is finite, the usual sum is always a limit point of the topological sum (although it may not be the only limit point). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.) (Revised by AV, 24-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm tsmsid(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cgsu, c1), co(c0, ctsu, c1)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(c0g, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ccmn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ctps))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c4, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, cfsupp, c3))
} = {
  eleqtrrd(co(c0, cgsu, c1), co(c0, ctsu, c1), cfv(cfv(ccl, cfv(ctopn, c0)), csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1))), w0)
  sylibr(w0, wcel(co(c0, cgsu, c1), cfv(cfv(ccl, cfv(ctopn, c0)), csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1)))), wss(csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1)), cfv(cfv(ccl, cfv(ctopn, c0)), csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1)))))
  syl2anc(w0, wss(csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1)), cfv(cfv(ccl, cfv(ctopn, c0)), csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1)))), wcel(cfv(ctopn, c0), ctop), wss(csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1)), cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0))))
  syl(w0, wcel(cfv(ctopn, c0), ctop), wcel(cfv(ctopn, c0), cfv(ctopon, c2)))
  topontop(cfv(ctopn, c0), c2)
  sseqtrd(csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1)), cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0)), c2, w0)
  snssd(co(c0, cgsu, c1), c2, w0)
  gsumcl(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, w0)
  syl(w0, wceq(c2, cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0))), wcel(cfv(ctopn, c0), cfv(ctopon, c2)))
  sylib(w0, wcel(cfv(ctopn, c0), cfv(ctopon, c2)), wcel(c0, ctps))
  istps(c0, cfv(ctopn, c0), c2)
  toponuni(cfv(ctopn, c0), c2)
  sscls(cfv(ctopn, c0), csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1)), cuni(cfv(ctopn, c0)))

  ovex(c0, cgsu, c1)
  tsmsgsum(c0, c1, cfv(ctopn, c0), c2, c3, c4, c5, w0)

}

blocks.name: haustsmsid
blocks.content: In a Hausdorff topological group, a finite sum sums to exactly the usual number with no extraneous limit points. By setting the topology to the discrete topology (which is Hausdorff), this theorem can be used to turn any ` tsums ` theorem into a ` gsum ` theorem, so that the infinite group sum operation can be viewed as a generalization of the finite group sum. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.) (Revised by AV, 24-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm haustsmsid(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, ctsu, c1), csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1))))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(c0g, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ccmn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ctps))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c4, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c1, cfsupp, c3))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(ctopn, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, cha))
} = {
  mpd(w0, wceq(co(c0, ctsu, c1), csn(co(c0, cgsu, c1))), wcel(co(c0, cgsu, c1), co(c0, ctsu, c1)))
  tsmsid(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, w0)
  haustsms2(co(c0, cgsu, c1), c0, c1, c2, c4, c5, c6, w0)
}

thm tsmsinv(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wf(c3, c5, c4))

} = {
  tsmsmhm(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c2, cfv(ctopn, c2), cfv(ctopn, c2), c5, c6, w0)

  syl(w0, wcel(c2, cgrp), wcel(c2, ctgp))

blocks.name: tgptsmscls
blocks.content: A sum in a topological group is uniquely determined up to a coset of ` cls ( { 0 } ) ` , which is a normal subgroup by ~ clsnsg , ~ 0nsg . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 24-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: tgptsmscld
blocks.content: The set of limit points to an infinite sum in a topological group is closed. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm tgptsmscld(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, c4, c3))
} = {
  pm2.61dne(co(c0, ctsu, c1), emptycls, w0, wcel(co(c0, ctsu, c1), cfv(ccld, c2)))

  n0(hs0, co(c0, ctsu, c1))

  ex(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, ctsu, c1)), wcel(co(c0, ctsu, c1), cfv(ccld, c2)))
  eqeltrd(co(c0, ctsu, c1), cfv(ccld, c2), cfv(cfv(ccl, c2), csn(cv(hs0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, ctsu, c1))))

blocks.name: tsmssplit
blocks.content: Split a topological group sum into two parts. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 24-Jul-2019.)

thm tsmssplit(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {

blocks.name: tsmsxp
blocks.content: Write a sum over a two-dimensional region as a double sum. This infinite group sum version of ~ gsumxp is also known as Fubini's theorem. The converse is not necessarily true without additional assumptions. See ~ tsmsxplem1 for the main proof; this part mostly sets up the local assumptions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Sep-2015.)
